document.masterDocTitle: Australian Nitidulinae: general review with descriptions of new genera and species (Coleoptera: Nitidulidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Australian Nitidulinae: general review with descriptions of new genera and species (Coleoptera: Nitidulidae)

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. Length = 3.30–4.20 (3.78 ± 0.26, n = 8) mm. Body ( Figs 1–2 ) oblong, moderately convex: BL/EW = 1.49–1.62 (1.56); GD/EW = 0.61–0.68 (0.64). Dorsal and ventral surfaces, legs and antennae primarily yellowish-brown; head dark brown; pronotum with distinctive black markings, usually consisting of a broad longitudinal band divided posteriorly by a light area in front of scutellum and a pair of black lateral maculae varying in size and shape; elytra with pair of anterolateral black maculae partly overlapping humeri, a zig-zag black marking crossing both elytra at about middle, and a pair of posterior black maculae; undersides primarily yellowish-brown with elytral epipleura somewhat lighter. Dorsal vestiture consisting of a relatively sparse covering of moderately long, fine, decumbent setae and ten longitudinal rows of erect, light-coloured, brush-like setae; ventral surfaces and legs with relatively sparse covering of short, decumbent, fine setae.

Biology . All specimens have been collected in flight intercept traps.

Etymology. Generic name a shortened combination of the Latin aenigma , riddle, mystery, and part of the generic name
Physoronia
. Species name from the Latin echinos , hedgehog, referring to the dorsal vestiture.
